content.body: You can still apply CSS using <?xml-stylesheet?>?? Really? Amazing... https://www.w3.org/Style/Examples/001/doc.xml

content.body: Wonder if xml-stylesheet in doctype internal subset is interoperable yet

content.body: zcorpan: wait what? What does that look like?
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: wait what? What does that look like?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: zcorpan: wait what? What does that look like?
zcorpan: wait what? What does that look like?

content.body: "For potential xml-stylesheet processing instructions that are in the [children] property of a document type declaration information item, xml-stylesheet processors may report to the application the parsing result of invoking the rules for parsing pseudo-attributes from a string, using the processing instruction information item's [content] property as the string. [Definition: If it is not reported to the application, the processing instruction information item is said to be ignored.]"
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: "For potential xml-stylesheet processing instructions that are in the [children] property of a document type declaration information item, xml-stylesheet processors may report to the application the parsing result of invoking the rules for parsing pseudo-attributes from a string, using the processing instruction information item's [content] property as the string. [Definition: If it is not reported to the application, the processing instruction information item is said to be ignored.]"

content.body: I wanted to change that to "must not" but that was not allowed according to the WG because some processors didn't ignore them and we'd have to change the version to 2.0 to make such an incompatible change, and then we'd have to introduce versioning because how would processors know which version to use??
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I wanted to change that to "must not" but that was not allowed according to the WG because some processors didn't ignore them and we'd have to change the version to 2.0 to make such an incompatible change, and then we'd have to introduce versioning because how would processors know which version to use??

content.body: Worked around it in CSSOM by only processing xml-stylesheets that are children of the document: https://w3c.github.io/csswg-drafts/cssom/#prolog
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Worked around it in CSSOM by only processing xml-stylesheets that are children of the document: https://w3c.github.io/csswg-drafts/cssom/#prolog

content.body: But maybe we can drop CSS support completely, don't know how much it's used
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: But maybe we can drop CSS support completely, don't know how much it's used
